Message.Title: not only conservative groups.....
Message.Msg: IRS targeted individuals as well. O's effort to stifle grass-roots activism that government normally encourages. It's the left's way. It's their nature. They are totalitarian. A group of anti-abortion activists in Iowa had to promise the Internal Revenue Service it wouldn’t picket in front of Planned Parenthood. Catherine Engelbrecht’s family and business in Texas were audited by the government after her voting-rights group sought tax-exempt status from the IRS. Retired military veteran Mark Drabik of Nebraska became active in and donated to conservative causes, then found the IRS challenging his church donations. While the developing scandal over the targeting of conservatives by the tax agency has largely focused to date on its scrutiny of groups with words such as “tea party” or “patriot” in their names, these examples suggest the government was looking at a broader array of conservative groups and perhaps individuals. Their collective experiences at a minimum could spread skepticism about the fairness of a powerful agency that should be above reproach and at worst could point to a secret political vendetta within the government against conservatives.

yes, I have been targeted every single year for decades and the totalitarians make me fill out forms and give them fincnacial information and I have to send them money every year. OMG, the injustice of it!! where can I whine about this? are there any groups I can join where we can all whine together and swap tall tales and figure out ways to game them and just commiserate and cry on each others shoulder?........

Message.Title: Tea Party conference participant suggests shooting a person to get them to change their mind
Message.Msg: " During a conference call sponsored by the tea party Wednesday night, a participant suggested that the best way to get Sen. Susan Collins, R-Maine, to change her mind on the issue of immigration reform was to “shoot her.” The threat of violence against the sitting senator elicited not shock, but laughs from other callers on the line."

Never be in a position of authority over a man? because "science" proves it?......Of course the bible says women should never be in a position of authority. The republicans probably want to repeal women's voting rights..... per "science" and the bible as the man must be dominant, right?

so it's business as usual at the IRS. Nothing out of the ordinary. Sights on conservatives just a figment of someone's imagination. Not a hint to scandal. It's all a plot to discredit O. the truth is coming out. Too many at the IRS were involved. Some will come forward.

the truth is out. some workers took some shortcuts, and profiled tea party to sort through forms... so what... they sad it was bad..... I don't really think so, but they did....... why not look first at the application of those most committed to cheating and whining about taxes.... ha ha ha... and oh sure...... if a republican says the IRS was mean to him........ that's it, there is no other side to the story?...... jeez...................you guys are morons really..... no doubt the IRS is the same as it was when bush was prez and it will be the same in a few years when Obama is out....... who are going to blame then for the evil of taxes and the taxman? gop have become totally dysfunctional, just a bunch of whiny brat liars and losers and nutcases... no wonder a decent Pub like Bob Dole had to call a time out for you children.

Message.Title: btw, a Bush appointee was running the IRS when the 'scandal' occurred, so blame BUSH
Message.Msg: looks like Bush is to blame. Bush appointed IRS boss Douglas Shulman,in 2008, left his post in November 2012, when his term expired. The so- called targeting of the tea party occurred ON Shulman's watch...... "While facing questions from lawmakers on Tuesday, Shulman said he doesn't know why his agency targeted conservative groups seeking tax exempt status. "I very much regret that it happened and that it happened on my watch," Shulman said."

Message.Title: why the IRS was reduced to using inappropriate shortcuts
Message.Msg: bottom line: ... due to the Citizens United ruling the IRS was swamped with "social welfare" applications....so how could they deal with the huge amount of paper work verification....when the gop CUT their budget and fired thousands of IRS employees??????? Oh, some workers took shortcuts........ "Between 2010 and 2012, the number of applications the IRS received each year seeking 501(c)(4) certification doubled.[18] During this period, budget cuts and personnel cuts reduced the IRS's ability to adequately perform its core duties.[19] When the Obama administration requested in 2011 that Congress increase the IRS's $12.1 billion budget by $1 billion to allow the agency to hire 5,100 additional agents, Congress instead reduced the IRS budget to $11.8 billion, and the IRS offered buyouts to 5,400 of its 95,000 employees.[19] The U.S. National Taxpayer Advocate, Nina E. Olson, told the New York Times in January 2012, "The overriding challenge facing the I.R.S. is that its workload has grown significantly in recent years, while its funding is being cut.... This is causing the I.R.S. to resort to shortcuts that undermine fundamental taxpayer rights and harm taxpayers — and at the same time reduces the I.R.S.’s ability to deliver on its core mission of raising revenue."[19]"

Topic.Title: why the IRS was reduced to using inappropriate shortcuts

Message.Msg: agree that Citizens United is a huge factor, but not for the reason you cite. Obama and his henchmen were so incensed at the Citizens United decision that they went on a mission to make sure conservatives could not get a footing. IRS was the tool.

Topic.Title: why the IRS was reduced to using inappropriate shortcuts
